data.title: “SFAKIANI” CHEESE PIE
meta_keywords: spread and travel our diet around the world
get our guests to experience a home-style gathering with local flavors
find recipes and cooking videos made with respect to our food culture and history
data.meta_description: This pie took its name from the Village “Sfakia” which is located on the south part of Chania. It takes a lot of practice to make it as it is very thin and stuffed with myzithra cheese. We serve it hot with thyme honey on top however, you can also use it as pita in salty recipes and combine it with meat or vegetables.
data.text:
This pie took its name from the Village “Sfakia” which is located on the south part of Chania. It takes a lot of practice to make it as it is very thin and stuffed with myzithra cheese. We serve it hot with thyme honey on top however, you can also use it as pita in salty recipes and combine it with meat or vegetables.

Dough:

500 grams white flour

100 ml olive oil

1 shot of raki

Pinch of salt

Water until you get a soft dough

Stuffing:

400 grams myzithra cheese

Topping:

Thyme Honey
